intro: Delissea degeneriana, commonly known as the rock fig, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its small, fig-like fruits that are typically green to yellow in color. The plant is typically found growing on rocky outcrops and in dry, sunny environments. It has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture. Delissea degeneriana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to arid conditions.
